intro: Echidnopsis somalensis, commonly known as the Somali echidnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and ability to thrive in dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or pale green, adding a delicate touch to its desert habitat. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Echidnopsis somalensis is adapted to survive in extreme temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species of the African savanna.
